Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Jar stand
Description: Jar stand made from a very pure and fine, orange-coloured Nile clay.  Asymmetrical in shape, the lower lip is flared whereas the upper one is convex. Both were decorated with a line painted in red ochre. Cutting marks made with a knife while shaping the lower section are still visible on the inside, of which only the upper section was polished.
